summary: Great shapewear!! With one important limitation....
reviewText: First, thank you to the hundreds of other reviewers who took the time to describe their perceptions of this product. Your reviews were very helpful in guiding me to select the appropriate size of this waist cincher. It is definitely sturdier than similar products I own. I like that there are two rows of eyes in which to affix the hooks. Right now, I am using the looser setting, but it is nice to know that the item will continue to fit once I lose 10-15 pounds, too. As advertised, this cincher narrows the waist and creates a more-hourglass shape. I find the item to be very comfortable - I can bend over repeatedly yet this stays in place and the bottom doesn't flip up, the way it does with other shapewear. The item is made of a rubbery material, which is probably why it is so flexible and strong. This has a downside: although I don't notice that I am perspiring when I am wearing the item, when I take it off, my skin is definitely clammy.The more significant limitation is something that could cause a wearer of this item great embarrassment. I discovered that this is not a good item to wear when exerting oneself - not because it is difficult to move in (quite the contrary), but because when the rubber heats up against the skin, it gives off a horrid burned rubber smell that others notice. I really wish I had anticipated that problem. Now that I know, I will probably reserve this cincher for home use only, and wear a Rago when out in public.

This bra runs small.  In most other bras, I wear a 40DD. The 42DDD is the size for me in this bra.  While the fabric gives and is not stiff, there is no stretch in the cups. The cups are not lined but the nipples don't show through this fabric. While there is no "padding", the fabric is not that thin stretchy type.  This bra delivers on it's "back and side smoothing" claims. It does a great job of smoothing those areas. This bra offers great support, and uplift. No underwire needed. No uniboobs. It gives a really nice shaping to the breast.  The smooth and seamless cups are my favorite type of bra to wear. It gives a smooth look under clothing. The straps are wider, but not really padded; however, I find this bra comfortable  to wear all day,The DDD"s have 4 hooks in the back and,  4 areas, instead of the typical 3 ...to adjust the band. This is one of those bras that gives a very secure feel when wearing.  The best way to describe; you'll feel "all in", secure and supported.  I feel supported all the way around; cups, sides, back and shoulders. No falling straps, riding up in the back and no tugging the bra back into to place during the day. Once on, nothing is falling, riding up or jiggling. The bra is set into place and stays that way until taken off.  Can certainly be used as workout  bra, but unlike typical sports bras, the  "V" is deep enough to wear lower cut tops and show our cleavage when desired.  It doesn't look like a harness.  It is a great fitting bra.  I purchased 3 and appreciate the fit of this bra so much, I'm actually going to hand wash them as the manufacturer suggest.

summary: Great sizing, but the material feels too thick and rough
reviewText: I bought a pair of these in 33W x 34L, which is not a common size. The sizing feels spot on, especially the length. I felt the waist could have been trimmed down a bit, these feel almost like a 34W.Although the material is mostly cotton with some polyester, it felt like the material is too thick and rough. It does have somewhat of a sheen to it, but I can see the material pilling or fuzzing with a few washes. They also feel a lot more like a khaki than a pair of office dress pants mainly in how the legs are hemmed.Also, Amazon's photo shows a rather large and ugly DOCKER's label on the right butt pocket. My pair only had a small anchor embroidered emblem which is hardly noticeable in the charcoal color.Overall: 4/5 stars, good sizing but the material feels too thick and rough. I'd love to have a pair of these in a polyester/rayon material.

I purchased a pair of these jeans over a year ago and didn't wear them much, thinking they were a little too long.  I've since come to like the length and have been wearing them at least two times a week; in fact, I just purchased two more pairs in the same size but different colors (Black as Night and Night Out). I really like the colors of those two -- the black is actually BLACK and does not seem like it will wash out.  Night Out is a nice, dark blue with contrast stitching. I also appreciate the mid-rise-ish rise as it does not give me a muffin top, but it is not too high.  The only problem I had is the newer pairs are a little too small (not sure if they changed the sizing over the last year or if the ones I have stretched a bit).  I've exchanged one pair for the next larger size, and am keeping the other since I've been losing weight and will fit into the smaller size soon. They are very fitting, with small ankle openings unlike some "skinny jeans" that turn out to be more like straight fit jeans. These leggings are quality denim, not thin material, and they hold their shape very well.  Overall I highly recommend these leggings, but be aware that you may have to go up a size.

What a deal! We're shocked by the high-cost of clothes these days, and lack the time or inclination to search for sales at the mall. These comfortable cotton t-shirts are sturdy, well-designed, roomy in the shoulders, and hold up well after repeated washings. Great for work or play, or chores, like when you must applyDuck Brand "Despicable Me" Printed Duct Tapein emergencies. These great shirts are so handy, we just find whichever color is available via Amazon Prime and order in bulk. Enjoy :)

I love Allegra K, it ALWAYS fits me. This showed up, no tag, and to small. I ordered a Large 14. It should be baggy on me. The seller says they have problems with getting Allegra K through customs. Allegra K ALWAYS has a tag, and runs true to size. It's VERY frustrating to order an item advertised, because of the name brand, only to end up with a piece of clothing that you can't wear. Use caution when purchasing Allegra K. I am finding multiple sellers using the brand name, but NOT shipping what you think you are ordering.

Bought this shirt for casual hiking outdoors. It helps keep me very dry, the fabric is polyester and is very "cool" to the touch. It feels good against the skin on a hot days hike, and helps the sweat evaporate quickly. I like the fit; 5'8" 140lbs the small fits perfectly, not loose just a bit snug. Polyester helps keep the sweat smell down moreso then cotton alternatives. I've worn this shirt for a few day backpack trek before (w/out cleaning/shower) and had no problem with itching or discomfort. For under 10$ you really cant beat this shirt!

I hate these.  I can't believe they get such great ratings.  They're uncomfortable and stupid looking.  I have short running shorts from Champion and Hind that I like much better, so it's not the length, but I'd rather run in board shorts or jammers instead of these, both for how they look and how they feel.  This is the first thing from Amazon that I bought that had such a high rating that I was really disappointed with.

summary: Not good for my height, thin mediocre material
reviewText: This bra is disappointing because if it were designed to be more height adjustable it actually would work. I am 5'3'' and 36C. I can not shorten the straps enough so I do not fit into the cups which also makes the bra "fold" instead of stay in place. Also the mesh piece across the top caves as if I am not wide enough, an unusual mishap for a bra and I am a classic 36C fit. The material is not as thick as it looks in the picture, is fairly thin and does not even have any layering to it as you would find in most sports bras (at least the ones I've come across). I am wearing it under a tank top with a bra shelf when I am doing lower impact workouts (racer backs pull on my trapezius muscles and neck) until I find something else.

I received this bra as a gift after surgery and it was heaven sent. It holds the girls great I still wear it. It's nice bra its thick but not so thick you are sweaty. Washes up nicely and holds shape good.

I wear clogs because of a bad back, clogs should be sized loose. I oredered the 8, and had to reorder the 7. I like the shoes alot, meduim solid fooot bed, not ultra soft like airwalk, not as hard as crocs. Not as narrow as crocs.Returns require merchant permission.

summary: cute; but i have much better
reviewText: this is a cute style handbag, but after looking in my closet i said i must be crazy, i have dooney & bourke brown REAL leather bags and did not  need a FAUX leather bag..but for anyone looking for something cute and stylish this would work...i am just really fussy..you could call me a handbg collector..usually designer ones only, but thought i  would give this a try..oh the orange one in this is much cooler/prettier looking..i returned this.

The blouse looks beautiful, the color I got is a gorgeous red with golden yellow, the material is a light airy, gauzy feel fabric that stays cool. The attention to detail gives these blouses a nice touch of class, the fabric is either 100% cotton or a cotton rayon blend made in India, also the instructions is for hand wash in cold water separately, hang to dry ( don't hang out in the sun, it may fade the dye), do not twist or wring. Putting these gorgeous blouses in the washer and dryer will ruin the beautiful detailing and will shrink. I wash by hand in cool to cold water using Woolite for delicate, just dip a couple of times, swish and rinse, hang to air dry in the shade or in the shower.The size is a "free size" that fits up to a 14, possibly a 16 in some, if you are on the smaller side the arm holes will be a bit longer and is advisable to wear a half tank underneath in the same color or a close match as the upper part of the top. The arm holes conceal nicely on me, I'm a size 12/14 in tops. I bought 6 of the blouses in different styles and colors, all I need to buy now is white shorts/capri and white pants.I highly recommend SAKKAS 100%. Great price, Great deals.SAKKAS keep coming out with different styles.THNX! ;)
I purchased these shorts for my adult son to sleep in. He loves them. He is 6'1" and weighs 160. The medium was perfect for sleeping. They wash and dry well.
Fit as described ad great compression socks,  Had knee and leg pains and now walk great, Helps relieve the pain and gives you he support you need

reviewText: I bought these when I got pregnant long before I was nursing. They expand perfectly as you grow. They're also so comfortable you can wear them to sleep.

summary: For the price, they are very nice~
reviewText: I wear them to break up an otherwise boring black top and slacks or jeans. Sometimes I WANT a certain color but the industry shows only a FEW colors in the stores. WHY? I want a BIG assortment. Do you want three choices on your menu where you dine? The colors I got were the exact green they show and the pink also. They do Not look cheap, (unless you have a cheap looking handbag or jewelry) When you mix & match expensive and inexpensive things, too me it works. They can possibly pass for a silk blend. Go on, hurry-get yours, I'll wait.

summary: Quality cream polish for leather shoes
reviewText: My leather shoes were getting scuffed up after a year of semi-regular use, so I did some research into the best kind of polish for them and settled on cream polish. I opted for the Meltonian based on its positive reviews, and I'm happy to report that it worked well for me too. It went on smoothly with a sponge brush, dried quickly, and still shone up nicely after polishing it with a soft cloth instead of a brush (which I didn't have on hand). My shoes look the best that they have since I first bought them. A little polish went a long way, too, so I know I'll get a lot of mileage out of the one jar I bought. Highly recommended.

reviewerName: l.chong "Go where there is no path, and leave...
reviewText: My sole reason for purchasing these was so that I could wear these with flats.  I have some ollie flats that I wear these with and it does a great job at protecting my feet.  I do not get blisters like I use to and when I wear these in the summertime I do not have the nasty sweaty feet that you get from wearing flats without socks.

I have ordered 4 pairs of these pants as they are so easy to care for and take a very light touch of an iron to look great.  They hold their shape and don't wrinkle.  They are versatile enough to be worn with a casual shirt, or a dress shirt and tie.  Excellent product and will buy again.

A few months ago I bought my first pair of Keen shoes, theKEEN Women's Newport H2 Sandal. I usually wear shoes between a 7.5 and 8, typically leaning more towards 7.5. However I took everyone's suggestion and went a half size up. I'm glad I did, because the size 8 was perfect. I loved my Keen H2's, and wore them the entire time my family and I were on our Disney/Busch Gardens/Beach vacation. They were comfortable the whole time.Fast forward to last week, now I was buying things for kids to wear for a week at summer camp. I thought they would each love a pair of Keens, since they were great for everything from hiking to water sports. I bought my son a pair of H2's, but for my daughter, I bought these keen Whisper shoes. After getting them she tried them on and wasn't sure about the open fit (she wears the same size 8 I do). The Whisper style is a little more open and sandal like, where as the H2's have a more of a closed shoe feel to them. So I brought up my H2's and let her try them on. She likes the more closed-shoe feeling of the H2's, and wanted them, leaving me with her Whispers.I have to say, I am glad she did. I LOVE the Whisper style. They are a just a tiny bit less bulky in appearance, and have a little more feminine shape to them. I like them so much, I want at least one more pair in another color. I have these in the Bluestone color, which is the perfect denim blue jean color.So if you're trying to decide between the Whisper and the H2, the H2 is a little more closed-shoe like, with a bit of a running shoe shape to them. The Whisper is more open and sandal like, having a little less bulk to their shape and designed more like a walking shoe. Both are equal in comfort, just different in shape. Both size 8's felt the same. If you're between a 7.5 and 8, go with the size 8.

These are great tights.  They fit snuggly and don't move around a lot when working out.  I was very comfortable in these doing a boot camp style workout.  The Aqua is EXTREMELY bright, but I got a lot of compliments from my group about loving the color.  I'm 5'10 and 200lb and I normally wear a large - I ordered a large and they fit perfect.  Not too tight, just right.  No chaffing and no itch (which I can get from other similar products if they're really tight).Recommend, for sure.
I ordered these and am wearing them. They are the Hanes conventional crew socks. I believe they are a little thiner then before, but not a problem. 1 to a 10 = 10
These briefs are well made and keep their shape through countless washings.  They are still looking nearly as white as they did straight out of the pack.
I was worried upon ordering, but got them and they are great, Being a traveling nurse am on my feet often during the day and these offer extreme comfort,  Thank you

got this belt for myself  and it is really nice. it has reinforced stitching so it will not separate into two it is a good belt

reviewerName: D. Deutsch "Chance favors the prepared mind."
reviewText: These jeans have been around in one iteration or another since the dawn of pants. Fit has been consistent from pair to pair as I've bought them over the years and quality appears to remain on par. This color looks nice and is pretty all-purpose for business-casual to casual-casual.

I always order 3X so I have extra room for large chest, but 3X is skin tight with big gap in bust area. I got a bit of a shock when I unpacked this handbag because it is HUGE..!!It reminds me of the saddle bags I had on my motor cycle in days of yore, but having said that I love the colour and the feel of the bag and the zips and leather ties and brass rings really make it a hardworking looking bag with style.I think I have a weakness for red leather and strangely it makes me feel like I have been taken back to the old west where cowboys hefted off these tough looking saddle bags off their steeds.Well I am certain this bag would take a lot of mail for the Pony Express and I love it.Stan ChunWellingtonNew Zealand.

summary: Came a week late, but worth the wait
reviewText: Unexpected shipping snafoo; it said it was delivered and it was----after an entire week went by. I bought this to use as a camera bag. I didn't want a "hi, I'm a tourist, please mug me because I have an expensive camera" type of bag. I lightly padded the interior and I can fit a DSLR and additional lens in there as well as typical travel documents and suncreen with plenty of room to spare. You can't tell there's a bulky camera in there, and I love the wide cross-body strap, and it's essentially water-resistant. I'm recommending this to a few friends who travel a lot and could use a good day bag.
Otherwise it's a nice top with a cute style. I am very impressed with Allegra K products overall. Decently made/sewed. I'd say it has a quality to it.

they run a little snug- The color & appearence is as shown- Good product- Comfy but snug-Shipping & packaging was very satisfactory- recommend product (just be sure you add at least a half to a size larger to your regular shoe order)recommend both seller & item-Granny

reviewerName: D. Deutsch "Chance favors the prepared mind."
reviewText: I have worn Dockers for years without complaint. Figuring out their "D" series nomenclature was an adventure. I equated the relaxed fit that preferred with the "D3", but wound up looking like I wore sails for pants. The "D2" is nice fitting pair of pants for a guy 5'6" 165lbs. Plenty of room, nice fit, no worrying about high winds.

summary: Wide Plastic Clog - Suitable for Several Uses
reviewText: The Crocs brand has an interesting history inspiring passion, love and hate.  When these clogs ("comfortable slip-on shoes") were marketed as high fashion, they were highly criticized.  Perhaps by definition, plastic shoes are not elegant and beautiful.  I finally was curious enough to try them.My Crocs, purchased through Amazon, were made in Mexico.  The size was true, neither too long nor short.  They're quite wide as intended.  I immediately liked them and started wearing them this summer.  I really like wearing them.  When I tried walking several blocks in them, I got blisters on the tops of my feet where the plastic rubbed even though the size was correct.  However, that's just my feet.  Many people can wear them everywhere.  I still like wearing them except for walking longer distances.I think Crocs make great casual footwear like around the house and especially beach or pool.  I like seeing people wear them in all kinds of colors.  Croc colors can be matched with shirts, hats and accessories.

I'm sure there are higher-quality pashminas to be had - I know there are more expensive ones - but for a fashion accessory rather than a true investment piece, this can't be beat!I love my new purple pashmina. I am quite sure it is, as stated, 100% pashmina. The purple color is exactly as represented in the photo, and it's warm but doesn't make me hot, it's soft(ish - as a pashmina should be), and it's properly wide and long to fold, tie, and wrap many different ways.It was hard not to notice the smell the pashmina carried with it upon being taken out of the cellophane it came in, but I am sure that was from the storage facility or factory. After a tumble in the dryer with some scented dryer sheets, the smell was gone and I don't expect it to return.If you love wearing scarves and wraps with different outfits, I highly recommend giving one of these a try!
I have the pink one so I decided to get the baby blue one.  It's fashionable, roomy inside, light weight, and packs nicely because it lays flat.  It also matches my shoes perfectly.
The colors were amazing, and the length was a little long, but the bust was a bit too small for me. I gave away to my niece since it was appropriate for her.

So though it may not look like much, this top will indeed leave anyone impressed as it show off the effectiveness of this blouse.
Is not a 100% supportive but work maybe help my breast are smallthe material is soft and fit perfect is more for have some support on the gymbut not for runcome on time

these are nice but they run small. I'm 5'4 and 130 and ordered the medium and they were tight. I'm not up and down and a curvy woman so that may have played a part but other than that they are nice and I love the loo of them.. very sexy..
This belt is very well made. It looks great and good to wear for work. It is a little stiff at first, but will wear in well.

summary: This is one Patty B top you don't have to hesitate ordering
reviewText: Believe me.. I've tried many of Patty's tops and dresses.  This one just WORKS for everybody.  The only person that may not like as well is someone 5 ft 1" or under since the torso might be too long.  This hides a myriad of sins, is warm enough for colder months, fine for summer in air conditioning and can be worn casually or dressy.  Don't be turned off by the big buttons (I was at first)..  Don't be.  They look just right on this top.  It will flatter your chest and shoulders with the perfect neckline.  It's soft so the sleeves aren't tight, but they're long.  Long and soft enough to push up if you want.  Thick in the middle?  No worries. The way this is made it will camouflage that extra weight many of us baby boomer women carry in our midsection.The top is sexy, but in a conservative way if that makes sense. This one isn't too low cut on me, while it would show "enough" cleavage for bigger busted gals.  You can pull the cowl up and fold it over a little if you find it too low - and it stays!  The fabrication is perfect making it a perfect transitional piece.  You might considering ordering down if you're between sizes.  This top has enough give and stretch, but the material isn't a bit sleazy.  Patty has some tops which are more questionable in terms of fabrication and being as well made as this one!!!I can find absolutely nothing wrong with this beautiful PattyB.  I just want women to know THEY DON'T NEED TO WORRY ONE LITTLE BIT when ordering this one. I know I sweat ordering some of Patty's tops- simply not sure about the quality and fit.  This top I'll soon have ordered in every color available.  This is certainly one that IS worth the price.  I can't say that about all PB tops.Now.. here's my original review.  I just wanted women to know this is truly a no-brainer.  You'll love it and want to keep it- and possibly order more for your sisters and girl friends. It has a consistent fit in all colors.______________________________________________________________This one in size small fits perfectly.  I'm 5' 6" tall, around 120 lbs and long torso.  This top is cute and fits like a dream.  I started with the chocolate, came back for gray (haven't received) and lastly ordered in black (just received but haven't tried on and praying it fits like the brown).Don't hesitate on this adorable top.  It looks just like the photo on the bod.  It's my fav and soon I'll own 3 if the other 2 fit like the chocolate.  You'll LOVE it!

Size med fit great - too help ya'll in sizing; I'm 5'5', 145# athletic build and 34b bust. The material is thinner than expected. I wish it had been more of a sweater than just a pullover. Happy buyer
This fits me just as expected. I LOVE the length of it! It is SO comfortable, and even sexy. I wear it a lot. I LOVE it!

I followed the tentative sizing chart and received a beautiful dress. It is absolutely worth it. The design is so pretty and the dress fits perfectly. I absolutely love this. It looks so good on; this picture does not do the dress justice.
nice necklace for the price. Looks good on and doesn't look very cheap. It is a good price for the quality

it is always nice to have a stud earring this one gose good with any thig I wear like a black dress thank you

Wrangler makes a great pair of somewhat loose fitting rugged, durable jeans for any  guy who wants a slightly more relaxed look to their work (or play) jeans. Moreover, these jeans are a good choice for people like me who are slightly overweight. They really do give you extra room in the thigh and the seat; and that's great!The denim is nice and thick; and these jeans are extremely durable. The excellent stitching helps make this possible. In fact, these jeans can last for years at a time without any fraying--even at the bottoms of the legs. They are made from cotton and they are permanent press. However, I would wash these jeans with similar colors to avoid any color dye bleeding onto white garments in the wash or dryer cycle. They say that you should tumble dry these on low; but I use the permanent press settings on my dryer and that seems to work fine without any problems. They come in five colors, too. Black jeans are even possible in an office where you don't have to dress too fancy but yet blue jeans just won't be allowed, either.Overall, these fine jeans by Wrangler easily rival any jeans made by other manufacturers. Make sure you choose the right size and color for you if you're using the pricing and availability chart above on this webpage. If you want a pair of loose fitting yet rugged, durable jeans, this may be just what you're looking for. I doubt that you'll be disappointed.

I never could get 33x34 elsewhere and this was great.  Good find after  so many years! Excellent finish and material, highly recommend. The pockets are deep and has a small coin sub pocket also on the right hand side. Length and wasit was perfect as per specification.

summary: Cute shoe, soft leather, but rub backs of heels
reviewText: I purchased these a half size up from my usual size which was a good idea length-wise.  The leather is very soft and not stiff like some shoes.  Unfortunately I could tell right away that the back of the shoe would make it quite painful to wear by digging into the backs of my heels.  The shoes also felt a bit narrow, so while the foot bed was cushy enough, they still felt weird on the sides of my feet.  I did like the cute criss-cross design down the heel backs. I really wanted to like these but will be sending them back.
Fits great, looks great, comfortable and cute. The black is not transparent as some reviewers have expressed. The length is a tad long, but nothing I'm worried about. Very satisfied.

I washed and dried them and they shrunk enough that they looked real good on him for about one hour before he had to wear a belt to hold them up.  It turns out that I found an old pair of 36x32 that are perfect and he is wearing them this weekend.  I also found a stack of 34x32 that he will never be able to wear again and will go directly to a church thrift store along with about 20 shirts that are almost new but too small.The Relaxed Fit was TOO relaxed and was returned for the Classic Regular Fit.

summary: Wonderfully soft and also effective at wicking away sweat
reviewText: I picked this up for my husband as part of the Vine program, and he's worn it twice now.  The bamboo fabric is incredibly soft and cozy-feeling, and yet it's also extremely effective at wicking away sweat.  My husband is a heavy sweater, but he's been wearing this for his P90X3 workouts, and it stays pretty dry.I've also washed it twice (on regular cycle) and have tossed it in the dryer, and it hasn't shrunk at all.The only caution I have is that this seems to run a bit small.  My husband is pretty much a Large in workout shirts by Champion, Under Armour, and Adidas, and yet the XL in this fit him more like a large.  If you're unsure, I'd suggest ordering a size up.Overall, though, this is a great workout T-shirt, and I may buy a few more for him when he needs more new T's.

reviewText: If you normally buy Levi's and say you wear a size 18 or 20 in those, although the equivalent size for a 20 is this 30x30, they just don't fit.  They're REALLY small around the waist (waist measures a 29.5 but these pants are a 30 and they're STILL too small!), and they're big in the seat and thighs.  Most guys have large thighs so for the catcher in this house, thought these would do the trick.  Well, they don't.  Don't have a clue why the waist is so off but he can't get these buttoned.  He wears a size 18 in Levi's.So, that said, these run really small.  However, they looked like he had a sack on in the rear and in his thighs.  Very strange experience.  The jeans themselves are very, very nice, which is one reason I'm sad they don't work.  Would LOVE to keep them but these are just off the mark completely.  I do recommend them since they're the upscale ones compared to the junk Walmart sells, but keep the sizing in mind when ordering.

summary: A surprisingly nice piece of costume jewelry for the price
reviewText: At the time I ordered the dragonfly pendant and chain, it cost less than a dollar, including free shipping. I've been ordering some of these inexpensive pieces of costume jewelry from China to use as gifts to the young nieces in our family, and both my wife and I have been pleased with them. The jeweled dragonfly won't fool anyone into thinking that it's expensive jewelry, but it's good quality costume jewelry. At a glance, the pendant and chain looks more expensive than it is, and with a weight of 0.4 ounces, it has the feel of more expensive metal than the bronze alloy it's actually made from.Note that the actual size of the pendant is 1.6"x1.6". The product description incorrectly shows 2"x2".Delivery from China took 19 days from the time I placed the order.

I ordered three pairs of Ugg's from Amazon this winter. Two pairs that I received were authentic and one pair were fake.  The fake Ugg's had the holographic tag, came in a box with a holographic sticker, and with packing and materials identical to the authentic Ugg's -- the only way I was able to tell the fakes were that they absolutely REEKED.  The boot itself smelled fine, like sheepskin, but the soles smelled VERY strongly of new plastic or chemicals. I could smell it before I'd even pulled them out of the box.  Real Ugg's do not have this smell.  Go to any fine department store and smell for yourself. If you receive Ugg's and the soles smell strongly of paint/chemicals/plastic... return them, they are not authentic.  If you are familiar with those foam rubber jigsaw puzzle pads they make for babies... it's that kind of smell.At the time I purchased the boots, Amazon was not an authorized seller of Uggs (apparently they now are), however a number of the marketplace sellers on the site are.  If you visit Ugg's website, you can find a list of authorized sellers.  Unfortunately, as I discovered, several sellers on Amazon are using names very similar to authorized vendors but are not actually that vendor.  So be careful.  Some of these folks selling the fakes are still charging $180 for the classic tall.  You will not find authentic Ugg's on sale, reduced, or anything like that at any authorized site.  If you want real Ugg's be prepared to pay full price for them or end up with fakes.The AUTHENTIC Ugg's I received were both from Shoe Central out of Ashland, Oregon -- they ARE an authorized dealer.  I love my Ugg's. I waterproofed them and that worked well for walking in heavy snow.  My toes were toasty warm.  Very comfortable.  I'm very happy!

I've tried 2 other, cheaper toe-sock options on Amazon, and came back to Injinji, since the custom-fit  Injinjis offer, esp. in the toe area is way more comfortable. The cheaper alternatives I've tried can't get the toe-length and width distribution right, as a result you frequently get extra space on toes that get folded over and cause discomfort on long-runs.Injinjis do a better job of not moving around/slipping in the heel area as well.As for durability, having owned almost a dozen Injinji socks in the past, I can attest to the 'Original Weight' ones' durability, with 20-30 miles of running per pair/ per week, they always last me over 6 months. (Lightweight ones are not as sturdy, but that's to be expected).If you have budget constraints, you can do like I do , and wear cheaper ones for lighter practice runs and  Injinjis for serious drills

summary: Lots of pros, but the two main cons are deal breakers
reviewText: First, the pros:- Opaque.  I'm a size 8 and I could easily wear them as a pair of pants (as opposed to just leggings).- Ridiculously comfortable.  The inner lining feels *wonderful.*  I cannot overstate this - they feel heavenly.- Not too long.  I'm 5'3" and they're is only the tiniest bit of fabric bunching around my ankles.  Worth noting though is that they're very stretchy and would probably fit just as well on someone a good deal taller than me.- Warm.  This is the whole reason I got them, and they've not disappointed. They wouldn't be enough for seriously cold weather, but if you're just walking around a chilly house, these'll do the trick.- Sexy.  I mean, they're essentially yoga pants.  Of course they're sexy.Cons:- As a general "hey, this doesn't matter to me, but it might matter to you," the crotch on these pants is very low.  Again, I'm kind of short, so it's not noticeable, but taller women might want to reconsider.  Of course, everyone should reconsider buying these because...- The other reviews are not kidding about the smell.  I read them and thought, "eh, I'll just soak them."  No.  No, you cannot just soak them.  These pants smell so strongly of chemicals that I had to leave work to go change.  It is incredibly overpowering and will saturate a small space in minutes.  Imagine cleaning your bathroom and not opening a window or turning on a vent, because it's exactly like that.  Literally nauseating and it doesn't go away.- I'd also read that these pants pill easily after washing, which - again - I dismissed as something easily solvable:  I'd just hand wash them.  Unfortunately, that didn't stop them from pilling.  Oh, they were fine after I finished laundering them, but they pill pretty much when they come into contact with anything.  It'd be one thing if they pilled where my thighs touched at the top, but they're pilling at the backs of my thighs where I sit on my feet.I would love - LOVE - to love these pants.  They just feel so, so, so good.  But I won't be buying another pair.

summary: Mine looks better than the picture!
reviewText: Size is dead on! One Size: ( US Size 0-14, Length 30" Measured Top Shoulder to Hem)Nice fit and very flattering.icky smell - wash in white vinegar and cold water and line dry -to set the dye AND get that smell out!If I paid the "Original " Price:  $69.99 I would be upset to have to set the dye and work on the smell! but for 20 bucks - that is fine!The colors - the picture has gold threads and lavender and purple material.... NOPE the purple is actually more vivid and beautiful on the one I received and the threads are all a silvery lavender  - I love what I got but it is not as pictured. So again - if I paid the "Original" price I would be upset - but for 20 bucks and something I like better than what I thought I was getting, I am happy.
Nothing to write home about, but for the price...I have no complaints. The octopus is a lilttle smaller than i thought, but the length of the chain is just right.
I bought two of these from different vendors on Amazon on the same day.  This is by far the better of the two.  It's heavier, sturdy, well made and it's easy to change the tips.  Excellent tool .

summary: Clarks Women's may poppy loafer black crock shoe
reviewText: These shoes look good but are awkward when you wear them.  They're a bit heavy too and not very comfortable.

My wife got me this fleece as a Christmas present, and I really like it.  It is lighter than some other fleeces I own, which is nice.  We live in the south east and it doesn't get frigid here nearly as often as it did in the Mid-Atlantic region, so I find myself looking for more mid-to-lightweight sweaters and fleeces.  This is a perfect fleece for layering.  The color is nice, the fabric is soft, and I have plenty of room to move when wearing it (6 ft. tall, 42R suit size).  I would recommend this to anyone looking for a lightweight fleece.

summary: Sized right but strange shapped cups
reviewText: This bra was very supportive and was true to size but the cups created a strange shape that I could not live with.  This bra had minimal elastic and provided very firm support if you can live with the strange shape.

summary: The Black Ones I Ordered Have 1% Polyester; the White Ones I Ordered Have No Polyester
reviewText: I ordered both the black and white socks. Despite the advertised ratio, which included no polyester, the black ones are labeled having 1% polyester.  The white ones were as advertised.The price was so favorable that I didn't send back the black socks.  But I can really feel the difference that 1% polyester makes and I would not buy them again.  Also, if you take a pair of black socks on one hand, and squeeze, and compare to doing that with the white pair in the other hand, you'll notice a giant difference.  The black socks feel like 50% polyester.Both the black and white socks feel pretty thick and warm.  The white ones, upon wearing and washing, have shed clumps of material.  Higher quality socks cost disproportionally more, I think.Do not get the black ones.
The top is really nice I love the material. It is so comfortable to wear. I love it and would recommend this blouse to anyone. I wear it around the house door out.
I received this after a month. Apart from the wait time, the piece was very elegant, especially for the price. I wore it today and it looks great!

reviewerName: D. Deutsch "Chance favors the prepared mind."
reviewText: This is a very nice slipper. It looks and feels comfortable and well-made. I thought the medium would be fine for my daughter, but I had to get her a larger size. I don't want to discount a growth spurt, but they seemed a little snug regardless.
This Orthaheel sandal was needed to rid myself of foot pain before it came back as bad as it has been in the past.  It works well for short periods of time.
very colorful, looks pretty and looks fun. would add lots of color to any outfit. shipping was quick. was purchased for a friend

These shirts did not keep me warm at all. I work outside and have to wear layers of clothing especially in the bitter cold mornings. When I purchased this product I was expecting it to keep me warm based on all the reviews these shirts got. Well I am a bit bummed ....Dont waste your money..not a good product at all. Now i wear them to bed...thats what these shirts are good for.

I wanted a nice, lacy, red bra. And this was a very reasonably priced bra that fit. The problem is the front clasp. If you fill out the bra (the correct size) the underwires stick straight out above the clasp. There is no shirt that would hide the little "horns". Bummer, back it goes.
Excellent belt. Fits my docker pants very well. Design is also great. The color, rustic feel all point to a classy design.
I took a chance ordering this online and I'm so glad I did.  It fits very true to size and was shipped quickly.  It's a wonderful shirt and I would highly recommend it.
I love them. They fit beautifully.  I have washed one and it is like new.  Great casual wear for Winter months.
I am a fashion stylist and blogger and I love this cute necklace. I bought it for every cat lover I know :)

These are a good find for the money. Really, 5 dollars each. They are long, so if you dont like long cami's, these aren't for you. I like mine long to come under my tanks. The straps are adjustable, and the colors are great!

I'm sorry, but these jeans are very nice looking on the model. But do not look or feel as they should in person. Way too long for a 5'2" person as I myself. I got the size 9 basing it on my curvy figure and weight of 125 lbs. And they dragged on the floor. Quite baggy, but yet tight in the waste. I really get disappointed in wasting such money on a guess. Maybe these would look better on a thinner, taller person, I don't know. But they did not work for me at all.

summary: Stays put and doesn't show on most shoes
reviewText: These really do NOT slip. They have something on the back heel to keep it in place that works very well. I also like how low cut they are. I only have one or two pairs of shoes where these would be visibile. Most shoes are not so low on the toe line that these would be visible. They're pretty comfortable, the back did dig in just a little bit but I think I'm just sensitive to that and these dug in much less than other liners I've tried. They're pricey but they are so much better than the ones I was buying at Target before!
Good belt for the working man. I am hard on my belts, but the Carhartt belts hold up pretty well. Can't go wrong for the money. Also, the belts look good, giving a decent appearance.

These pants are a bit long, but were easily hemmed to length. The material is medium weight & stretches well to form and movement. The sizing is exactly on spot with little room for error. Pretty nice product for the price.
Just warning, if you normally wear 12 short jeans, dont get these in petite, they are too short. They are also rather tight around the waist, i recommend going up a size

I bought the white and they fit perfectly. I had to wear it for the first time over 18 hours. The straps remained comfortable and there was no cutting into my flesh by an underwire. At less than $7 for the white, this was too good a deal to pass up. I wish the black would come down in price.

The fit is actually pretty accurate, and looks just like the pic.  The material that forms the facade of the blouse is made of a polyester cotton blend, so the cone does not fall as elegantly as shown on the pic.  But all in all, not bad for the price.

Although the material is soft, this bra offers virtually no support and I am not a busty woman at all. This is very thin material and does not look like the picture at all which seems to elude to the fact that this offers support. Not so! Yes, it is comfortable and fits well, but it's not an everyday bra nor is it a bra for working out in. I am glad I only purchased one as this will be the last one I buy!

summary: Clarks is my favorite shoe maker and ordering from Amazon I Get the Best Price
reviewText: Very comfortable shoe with adjustable strap for those with a high instep or sometimes swollen feet. Good summer shoe for dress-up or casual.

summary: Size 5 is too small and narrow for my feet
reviewText: My feet are a Wide size 5, and these were way too narrow for me (I was hardly able to get my foot in at all). They look really comfortable, so I might try a size 6!

I bought these leggings in my usual size medium, and found them to be way too tight.  The material was thin and shiny, and they gave me an unflattering look in the crotch.  I expected them to be fitted, but not like pantyhose.  I'm going to return them.

summary: Very nice for $23. Size a little off...
reviewText: Love this boots. Specially the $23 price tag for my size. I got the black one and they look great and seem to be good quality>I read the review regarding the size: so I bought 1 size up. I'm a 7 1/2 so I ordered an 8. It was too big so I exchanged them for an 8 and shoes fit perfect. So my experience is to just order HALF a size up not a whole size. Even if it was a little pain (nothing crazy) to find my exact size, I recommend the boots.
Were a bit firmer; it's very soft and while comfy, doesn't provide quite the support needed for a fuller bust. But COMFORT REVOLUTION is right - I plan to get a few more of these!!!!

summary: Who needs Nike?  NO ONE. GREAT for women runners!
reviewText: Finally.  JUST A PLAIN SHORT.  I don't need a logo - orfancy styling.  Who's thinking about all that when theyrun (IF they are truly a runner - and not just awho's-best-dressed in the gym contest).  Give me a break.I'm a woman, in great shape - run every day 3-5 miles.I'm 5'4", and 125 pounds.  The small fits like a glove(think bubble butt - but attractive), and if you're anybigger than this (37" hips) (28" waist) go with themedium. But, if you are planning to to a lot of picking upor bending over in these (tennis maybe?) get the mediumif you're my size. >>>> Just running  - get the small.Super lightweight (I have the black and blue which areNOT see through by the way) and dries in HOURS - whenhung to dry.No drawstring, no need for it/zero crotch seems... one very VERY small innerpocket which I (nor most real runners) ever use / I cut thatout asap.Love love love these shorts. I can't imagine ever in my lifepaying Nike or any other brandname price ($24.00 and up) forONE pair of running shorts.I'm not thinking about the shorts when I run.You shouldn't either.Buy buy buy ----...and a special thank you to the MEN here who answered myquestions and helped me find the right size.Just waiting for more in blue/small to come in stock!So happy!!!Buy!Wear!Run!(right there is a tag inside the back which might beitchy to some, but not to me...I'm not particularly"tactile defensive".  You can rip the back tag off...leaves a little glue which softens and flakes offafter another run in the washer / dryer - yes, these shortscan take the dryer!  Just don't put them in wiht ANY VELCRO!
I love the bra, the cup size is perfect. The bra just fits around me too tight even in the last loop.

summary: Loved the shorts, so I bought these pants! Same exact design as the shorts except they are pants.
reviewText: The title says it all, I loved the Blackhawk shorts so much that I bought the pants. The sizing is spot on, and the elastic waistband does expand so a size 32 waist can go up to about size 34 with the elastic.My complaints about the shorts are still valid with the pants. The seat area is too baggy. In some instances, it looks like you have extra baggage in that area, when it really is just a generous amount of material that bags up.There are pockets and zippered pockets galore, just like the shorts (in the same exact locations/style/design). These blow the Tru-Spec and 5.11 pants/shorts away due to the pocket/storage design and the fit.Overall: 4/5 stars, I wish they tailored the seat area so the material doesn't bulge out in the back.

The necklace I received does not even look like this. It is a piece of rectangle metal with a circle of metal attached. The black is very sloppily painted enamel. It is garbage and will be disposed of as such.

This dress is adorable, it is a tad loose on me but is easily fixed, and still looks very cute.

I already had 2 pairs of go walk and I love them so I had to buy these because they were half the price I paid in the store.I was a little disappointed at first that the fabric was different from the other pairs.  The first 2 pairs are more of a mesh fabric which makes them very cool to wear in the summer.  This pair is more of a light weight canvas but everything else about them is the same.  They are super comfy and have a nice amount of cushion under my feet plus the fact that you can just throw them in the wash and they come out looking like new is a big plus.  I've had shoes that were labeled "washable" before but they never came out looking as good as when they went in.  These wash great and I'm sure that when Fall rolls around a solid upper instead of a mesh one will be a good thing.

I really like this sweater!  We've had some unseasonably warm April days, and I've loved wearing this light tunic with leggings.  The fit is big; generous and forgiving, and the color is a bright daffodil yellow.The knit is very loose and snagable, so you'll want to be careful about snags and underwear, but I wore beige, draped a big scarf around my neck and didn't worry about it.  The scarf also helped with the very wide neck of this top.I like this sweater so much, I bought it in black.  I'm deducting a star because the weave seems very fragile.

reviewerName: D. Deutsch "Chance favors the prepared mind."
reviewText: Jacket fit my needs perfectly for one that is light, breathable, and waterproof. It protects even in heavy downpours and is not cumbersome to wear during warmer temperatures.  My only gripe concerns the hood tensioners. They don't hold their position well. A spring mechanism like on other jackets would have been preferred.  All told, I highly recommend this jacket.
I was excited to get this blouse but when i pulled it out of package :(not happy, material feels very cheap and the shoulder blade area is tight...its one of those "You get what you pay for"

I received these pants this week and they are of a good quality and not see-thru (I have the black color).  I am 5'10 and the length is perfect.  I chose a large and found it very true to size - a medium would have been very snug around my hips.  I wear a 6-8 pant size and weigh 155 lbs.  These are thinner than some other yoga pants I own (which is not a bad thing).NOTE:  I have figured out why other reviewers have said these see-thru.  If the pants are stretched tightly, they do become less opaque.  If yours are see-thru during normal use, you might need a bigger size.  I noticed mine going slightly see-thru when I put stress on the fabric while bending over or kneeling.  It is not enough to cause me any concern while wearing, though.

I have these in Grey and they fit wonderfully. I'm 5'11" 140lbs and the Medium after washing is the perfect fit. I got them in Brown and they are about 2" shorter than the grey. They're just house pants so its not a big deal. Also, I tend to be a small and both Mediums fit perfect, so they seem to run a bit small as well.All in all though, very comfy. Good stretch and return after washing. Cozy but light weight, great for summer nights.

I think the pink is a bit too bright (the screen makes it appear more fushia than hot pink). I will wear these those. The comfort is unsurpassed and these are so much more stylish than the clogs of the past!

reviewerName: D. Deutsch "Chance favors the prepared mind."
reviewText: I have worn Dockers for years with few complaints. I have read about problems with sizing and quality, but I have personally not experienced them. I find that these are great for business casual wear or weekend get-togethers. The only thing I have noticed is that the D3's seem to be cut baggier lately. Quality seems the same to me, but historically I found that Dockers don't last more than a year or so.

summary: FRUIT OF THE LOOM MEN'S TEE SHIRTS
reviewText: They were okay, not a true size medium, more like a man's small.  My husband is thin, and he didn't have much space after putting them on.  Hate to see what will happen when I wash them, hopefully they won't shrink.

These are very lightweight and comfortable shoes. Just got them today. I do think they run a little large, probably could have ordered a half size smaller, but are not so big that I am sending them back. I will probably use them more as casual wear shoes rather than for serious long walks (plan to wear my Nike flyknit shoes for that), but they are very comfortable for just everyday wear. I would say that the arch support is moderate for myself and not as good as my Nike shoes, but still great lightweight shoes for casual wear. They are a little loose fitting on the sides of the shoes, but with socks on will probably be fine. Great color, I love the chocolate brown color of these. Goes with a lot of clothes. I also like that they are not very expensive so you get good comfort without a big price tag.

summary: Necessity Really Is The Mother Of Invention Sometimes
reviewText: I owned a few pairs of toe socks back in the day mostly as a fashion statement. Heck, I was a kid back then and I lost them fast because they weren't comfortable.I swore I'd never buy Vibram Five Finger shoes, but I tried a pair and was hooked because I find them comfortable. I was at a premier running store in San Diego and bought a new pair of Vibrams and the salesman suggested I give these a try. The sales pitch included 'they'll keep your new shoes cleaner'. I tried on a pair that were thick and nixed them because they didn't feel all that great with the shoes, but the thinner version was really fine and I found that they wicked moisture which is definitely a plus. I bought just one pair, but ended going back to the store for four additional pairs......two in black and two in white.Out of the package, these look small but in reality these are light and stretchy. While they are perfect when teamed up with the Vibram shoes, they can be worn with other sport shoes. These should be hand or machine washed but lined dried. The manufacturer does not advocate machine drying.I didn't have any break in issues with these, but I suspect that other people may especially if they don't like the idea of having their toes wrapped. Also, I really doubt that these socks will do anything to realign your toes. What they do for me is prevent blistering, keep my feet dry, and keep my Vibrams clean. They are definitely far more comfortable than my original toe socks and far more durable. These do not pile and have kept their shape despite multiple machine washings. While they are not for everyone, if you like the Vibrams you'll probably like these.

I wear this endlessly. I received a TRUE Allegra K piece, and not an imitation knock off. As always with Allegra K, it fits EXACTLY as shown in the image. It is so soft. I wear it with legging, and shorts. It's become a staple to my wardrobe.  Inquire with the seller, make sure they ship TRUE Allegra K, and not a cheaply made look alike. If they ship TRUE Allegra K, you will LOVE it.
These were very uncomfortable when i first bought them. However, once I washed them, they are now my fav pair of slippers.

After trying 7.5M and 7M, will now order a 7C. I think that's going to work. Very nice, well-made shoes! UPDATE: The 7C/D was my right size in these. My usual size is 7.5M. When I ordered them before, they were a very cute slate blue, but this pair is a darker slate, more like a navy--which is what it's advertised to be.

This bra will fit like a charm. The bra fits comfortably as if you are not wearing a bra at all.  The fabric in the bra reminds me of the Coobie Strappy V-Neck Lace Trim Bras. You should no trouble with this bra and you may never need another one.

Levi's makes a great pair of somewhat loose fitting "relaxed fit" jeans for gentlemen who want a slightly more relaxed look to their jeans; and these jeans are also a good choice for people like me who are slightly overweight. The jeans also come with a straight leg that looks just a little bit more "clean cut" without getting formal at all. They give you extra room and they look good; and that's great!The denim is nice and thick; and these jeans are extremely durable. The excellent stitching--along with the cotton denim they use--helps make this possible. In fact, with proper care these jeans can last for years at a time without any fraying--even at the bottoms of the legs and at the five pockets. I also like the relaxed, very slightly oversized look on the sides of the straight legs.One extra bonus is that Levi's makes these jeans in big and tall sizes for guys; big and tall sizes are harder to find so this makes these jeans a great product for larger guys out there.Make sure you choose the right size and color for you if you're using the sizing chart along with the pricing and availability chart above on this webpage. In addition, although these jeans are essentially permanent press, I would wash these jeans with similar colors to avoid any color dye bleeding onto white garments in the wash or dryer cycle.If you want a pair of jeans with some extra room in the seat and thigh areas but yet come with a straight leg, this is exactly what you're looking for. Indeed, these fine jeans by Levi's outscore jeans made by other manufacturers. They are remarkably comfortable and yet the fabric is strong to make these last!

summary: my feet have never been so happy
reviewText: Crocs continues to make popular footwear--and these sandals should be popular, too. These Crocs Cayman sandals are extremely comfortable with their trademark loose fit; and they are so lightweight I could practically swear I'm not wearing anything on my feet! In addition, these sandals are great for both the gents and the ladies.They are quite loose and comfortable; and the sole is almost completely ribbed to lessen the chance that I could fall while wearing them. Although the soles of these Crocs are advertised to be "slip-resistant;" I would caution against running while wearing crocs anyway. You could trip and fall because Crocs are oversized; they are made this way for the sake of comfort.The footbed practically cradles my feet and these sandals are especially good for people who are always running around doing informal activities. They feel great regardless if you are walking around the big city, hanging out with friends, or just wearing them as a type of slipper inside the house. Excellent!These crocs also feature an adjustable rear heel strap; this can be pushed forward so that the crocs are more like clogs. Moreover, these sandals are made from a very strong form of rubber-like resin--which takes abuse like I never imagined it could. Crocs are intentionally manufactured to be extra wide and a bit extra long for comfort. That's great designing for you!One caveat: don't forget to check the "pricing and availability chart" before you order your pair of sandals. As of this writing not all colors are available in all sizes. I hope that stock increases soon!Overall, Crocs are one incredible way to keep my feet as happy as possible while I go about my daily activities. Get yourself a pair--you won't regret it!

These fit very well - I got the large, I'm 5'10" and 180 pounds. They're so comfortable and nice and long, which is awesome. The quality seems pretty high so hopefully they're worth the price. I'll update my review if they get holes in them soon or anything but they feel great so I'm optimistic!

My son also likes my Sloggers and as we were going out to lunch on my birthday last week, he asked me to wear my "hippie shoes" as I was selecting shoes to match my outfit.  Of course, I did wear them as we dress for our men don't we?  I also wore them to the Yankee Candle Store and the ladies there just loved them.  Wow!  I love them too.  I love them so much that I ordered the boots as well and they should arrive this week.  I have really broken in my Sloggers, today doing some muddy, wet gardening on my deck.  The colors in the shoes match an Anuschka Travel Tote that I have, it being beautifully painted leather.  Perfect match.  Also, a perfect fit with plenty of room for toes with no tightness any where. I think she has bought me a pair of pink Sloggers boots.  Oh, by the way, just wash them off with the hose and you're good to go.
They fit well and are well made Lee makes good jeans even after being around for so long thats probably why this is the case.

I love my blingy fit flops but it is nice to have a pairthat are plain, just as comfortable, add height, and are orthotic without looking orthotic.  This is a great brand.PLUS I bought them on sales and they were very inexpensive.  Highly recommend Fit Flops.I like the greyish color.  They are an open-gym-shoe looking pair. summary: Vintage Owl Pendant Long Bronze chain Necklace Clothes (Cute!)
